IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: George Stevens Academy is an independent high school located on the coast of Maine.
IRS990.MissionDesc: George Stevens's Academy is an independent high school located on the coast of Maine. Grounded in its traditions and commitment to the area's small towns. The Academy is a caring educational community invested in meeting the needs of each student. The Academy offers a challenging comprehensive program of studies that fosters intellectual inquiry and the pursuit of knowledge, inspires creativity, develops self-reliance, and prepares its graduates for a purposeful life in an ever-changing world.
IRS990.Desc: Provide secondary education to approximately 282 students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Provide financial assistance to graduating students who are furthering their education. Scholarships are granted on the basis of merit and type of continuing education.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Custodial funds are held for international students and for student government.
The Academy's endowment consists of funds established for a variety of purposes and includes donor-restricted endowment funds.
Returned Scholarships 25,509. Fundraising Expenses 20,304. Loss on Sale of Fixed Assets 7,487.
Fundraising Expenses 20,304. Loss on Sale of Fixed Assets 7,487.
The school has the policy on the school website
Not considered necessary since race does not factor into admission or employment
Scholarships are awarded to students based on criteria set forth by the donor and then dispersed directly to the college.

George Stevens Academy paid Accounting Services of Maine, LLC for services provided by Rachel Grivois. George Stevens Academy is not able to determine the compensation paid to Rachel Grivois, only the amount paid to Accounting Services of Maine, LLC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Question 11a is only answered no because a Public Disclosure of the draft Form 990, with donor's names and addresses redacted due to donor's requests to remain anonymous, is provided to the full Board rather than a filing copy.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All trustees sign the Trustees Statement of Commitment which requires that they not involve themselves in any matters in which they have a conflict of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Board of Trustees approves compensation for the Head of the School. The Head of the School approves compensation for administrators and there is a compensation committee to oversee all employees' compensation. Compensation is comparable for the area.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: George Stevens Academy paid $69,687 to Accounting Services of Maine, LLC, a company 100% owned by Rachel Grivois during the period 7/2022 - 4/2023 while she was a voting member of the Board. George Stevens Academy is not able to determine the compensation paid to Rachel Grivois, only the amount paid to Accounting Services of Maine, LLC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part X, Line 10: Land, Buildings, and Equipment:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Section 1.263(a)-3(n) Election: George Stevens Academy 23 Union Street Blue Hill, ME 04614-0816 EIN: 01-0247002 Section 1.263(a)-3(n) Election: George Stevens Academy is electing to capitalize repair and maintenance costs under Regulation Section 1.263(a)-3(n).
